Package database

Class SerializeDB

java.lang.Object
database.SerializeDB
public class SerializeDB
extends java.lang.Object
Contains methods to create, read and write .dat files.
Since:
2021-04-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jordon

    • SerializeDB

  • Method Details

    • readSerializedObject

      public static java.util.List readSerializedObject​(java.lang.String filename) throws FailReadException
      Reads the data saved in a .dat file into a List of Objects.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of the file that contains the data to be read. The file must be of .dat type in database/db.
      Returns:
      List of objects saved in the file.
      Throws:
      FailReadException - If the user tries to read data from a file that does not exist.

    • writeSerializeObject

      public static void writeSerializeObject​(java.lang.String filename, java.util.List list) throws FailWriteException
      Writes a List of Objects into a .dat file.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of the file to write the data. The file must be of .dat type in database/db.
      list - List of Objects to be saved into the file.
      Throws:
      FailWriteException - If the user tries to save an invalid list of objects into a file.

    • findById

      public static <T extends BaseModel> T findById​(java.util.ArrayList<T> items, int id)
      Searches for a BaseModel object in an ArrayList by ID.
      Type Parameters:
      T - A generic type that extends BaseModel.
      Parameters:
      items - ArrayList of BaseModel objects.
      id - ID of Object of type BaseModel to be searched for.
      Returns:
      Object if it is found. Else, null.

    • generateId

      public static <T extends BaseModel> int generateId​(java.util.ArrayList<T> items)
      Generates an ID for a new BaseModel object.
      Type Parameters:
      T - A generic type that extends BaseModel.
      Parameters:
      items - ArrayList of BaseModel objects.
      Returns:
      ID of type int.

    • createFileIfNotExists

      private static void createFileIfNotExists​(java.lang.String filepath) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a new file at filepath if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      filepath - Path to file (including the file name)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If there is an input or output exception.

    • checkIfFileExists

      public static boolean checkIfFileExists​(java.lang.String filename)
      Checks if a database file exists in the database folder db.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of the files to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if the file exists. Else, false.

    • getFilePath

      private static java.lang.String getFilePath​(java.lang.String filename)
      Returns the absolute path to a file inside database/db.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of the file to be opened. It must be of .dat type in database/db.
      Returns:
      Absolute path to the file.
